name: ifpfal
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: syl5bb(wn(w0), wif(w0, w1, w2), w2, wif(wn(w0), w2, w1))
stmt.pretty: syl5bb(¬ w0, if(w0, w1, w2), w2, if(¬ w0, w2, w1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wn(w0), wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), w2))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wif(wn(w0), w2, w1))
-| wi(wn(w0), wb(wif(wn(w0), w2, w1), w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wn(w0), wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), w2))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wif(wn(w0), w2, w1))
-| wi(wn(w0), wb(wif(wn(w0), w2, w1), w2))

body.origin: |- wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wif(wn(w0), w2, w1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wn(w0), wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), w2))
-| wi(wn(w0), wb(wif(wn(w0), w2, w1), w2))

comment: Value of the conditional operator for propositions when its first argument is false. Analogue for propositions of ~ iffalse . This is essentially ~ dedlemb . (Contributed by BJ, 20-Sep-2019.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 25-Jun-2020.)
